author: pcAdminPNG
title: National Fisheris Impact Projects
text:
The National Fisheries Authority on Thursday commissioned various community-impact projects in Gotomi in Yelia local level government area in Lufa district, Eastern Highlands Province.
These are one staff house for Gotomi Technical Vocational Training and its parametre fencing that is already in place, two 4-in-1 classrooms and a basket court for Gotomi Primary School in ward six and Lagaiyu Integrated Fish Farm in ward three, all within the Gotomi community.
The staff house that is being commissioned at Gotomi Technical Vocational Education Training centre. Lufa District Development Authority chief executive officer Demo Imara leading the National Fisheries Authority managing director Justin Ilakini and his team for the opening of two 4-in-one classrooms and a basketball court at Gotomi Primary School. Locals joining the Gotomi Primary School community to welcome the National Fisheries Authority managing director Justin Ilakini and his team. Locals turn up in numbers to witness the commissioning of two 4-in-1 classrooms at Gotomi Primary School. The two classrooms that are being commissioned at Gotomi Primary School. The Eastern Highlands provincial education director Wesley Albert giving a speech before the cutting of ribbon to mark the official opening of the classrooms and basketball at Gotomi Primary School. Locals turned up in numbers to witness the launching of Lagaiyu Integrated Fish Farm in ward three of Yelia LLG in Lufa district, Eastern Highlands Province National Fisheries Authority managing director Justin Ilakini (third from right) landed at Gotomi Technical Vocational Education Training centre to commission various community-impact projects in Yelia local level government area in Lufa district, Eastern Highlands Province. The Eastern Highlands provincial director for agriculture, fisheries and Livestock, Awesa Webster, cutting the ribbon to mark the launching of Lagaiyu Integrated Fish Farm while the National Fisheries Authority managing director Justin Ilakini and others look on. The ponds of the Lagaiyu Integrated Fish Farm in ward three of the Yelia local level government area of Lufa district, Eastern Highlands Province. The NFA managing director, Justin Ilakini, along with the senior staff and technical officers, flew in to commission these projects.
Led by the provincial corporate service director, Peter Gare, the provincial administration team comprising the senior officers from the divisions of education and natural resources, along with the Lufa District Development Authority chief executive officer, Demo Imara, joined the NFA delegation for the occasion.
The people of Lufa turned up in numbers to warmly welcome them.
Impressed with the positive impacts these projects are having on this geographically disadvantaged communities, especially during dry seasons, and convinced of the need areas to improve further, Mr Ilakini assured the people of more assistant to improve further.
Read more on Post Courier next week.
